Use dvd shrink to shrink the file enough that it fits on a 4.7 gb. disk create an iso backup file and then use DVD decrypter to burn the image on a dvd . this should form the file structure needed including an audio TS folder.Works for me.dvd decrypter and dvd shrink 3.2 are both easily freeware ,easy to get and easy  to understand have a ball---------------------------

the vlc media player is free, and actually is pretty cool.....i use that and watched it...its amazing...im not sure if u mean fork over cash for the VLC or for the actual DVD but vlc is free. i also downloaded codec and shit too at the same time as vlc....m not sure if tyhat had anything to do with it....as i said, im new to all this and am loving the shit out of finding out more...idk why its just fun.
